DIVISION 1. - COMCAST CABLEVISION OF BROWARD, INC.[5] 
ORDINANCE NO. 274 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING ORDINANCE NO. 256 RELATING TO THE FRANCHISE GRANTED BY THE TOWN OF LAUDERDALE-BY-THE-SEA, FLORIDA TO SELKIRK COMMUNICATIONS, INC., FORMERLY KNOWN AS "BROWARD COUNTY CABLE, INC." (FRANCHISEE), TO CONSTRUCT, OPERATE AND MAINTAIN A CABLE TELEVISION SYSTEM OVER AND BENEATH THE PUBLIC STREETS AND OTHER PUBLIC PROPERTY OF THE TOWN OF LAUDERDALE-BY-THE-SEA; TO CLARIFY THAT THE NAME OF THE FRANCHISEE IS NOW SELKIRK COMMUNICATIONS, INC.; TO PROVIDE FOR A SEVEN-YEAR EXTENSION OF THE FRANCHISE TERM, SUCH EXTENDED TERM TO EXPIRE ON AUGUST 25, 2000; PROVIDING THAT FRANCHISEE SHALL ENTER INTO AN AMENDED FRANCHISE AGREEMENT WITH THE TOWN INCREASING THE FRANCHISE FEE TO BE PAID TO THE TOWN FROM 3% TO 5% OF FRANCHISEE'S ANNUAL GROSS SUBSCRIBER REVENUES, SUCH AGREEMENT SUBJECT TO AND CONTAINING ADDITIONAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS; TO CLARIFY THAT THE NAME OF THE GUARANTOR OF THE OBLIGATIONS AND COVENANTS OF THE FRANCHISEE IS NOW SELKIRK COMMUNICATIONS LIMITED; TO IDENTIFY CURRENT APPLICABLE FEDERAL LEGISLATION KNOWN AS THE "CABLE COMMUNICATIONS POLICY ACT OF 1984"; TO DELETE THE REQUIREMENTS THAT THE FRANCHISEE COMPLY WITH CERTAIN BONDING REQUIREMENTS. 
    WHEREAS, pursuant to Ordinance No. 256, adopted November 28, 1978, the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea granted a franchise to Selkirk Communications, Inc., a Florida corporation (formerly known as Broward County Cable, Inc.), to construct, operate and maintain a cable television system over and beneath public streets and other public properties of the Town; and 
    WHEREAS, pursuant to Resolution, also adopted on November 28, 1978, the proper Town officials were authorized and directed to execute a franchise agreement with the Franchisee to effectuate the franchise granted, which agreement was duly executed at that time between the parties; and 
    WHEREAS, the Congress of the United States has duly enacted the Cable Communications Policy Act of 1984 (Public Law No. 98-549), which Act established a national policy setting procedure and standards for the development of the cable system industry and established guidelines for the exercise of Federal, State and local authority with respect to the regulations of cable systems; and 
    WHEREAS, a cable system has been constructed and completed according to the original Agreement between the parties dated December 8, 1978, which agreement was amended by the parties by agreement dated June 29, 1982; and 
    WHEREAS, the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Selkirk Communications, Inc. and Selkirk Communications Limited agree and believe it to be in their best interests to extend the term of the franchise; and 
    WHEREAS, the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Selkirk Communications, Inc. and Selkirk Communications Limited wish to amend numerous other provisions to said franchise agreement; and 
    WHEREAS, it is the desire of the Town to grant an extension of the franchise to Selkirk Communications. Inc.; 
NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE TOWN COMMISSION OF THE TOWN OF LAUDERDALE-BY-THE-SEA, FLORIDA: 
    Section 1: That there is hereby granted to Comcast Cablevision of Broward, Inc. the non-exclusive right, privilege or franchise to construct, maintain and operate in, under, upon, over, and across the present and future streets, alleys, bridges, easements, and other public places of the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Florida, until August 25, 2001, said term may be extended thereafter on a year-to-year basis upon the mutual agreement of the parties hereto, a cable television system for the purpose of supplying cable television and other services within the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, the precise nature of which is more particularly described in the amendment to the franchise agreement referred to herein. 
Note- See the editor's footnote to Art. III. Section 2 of Ord. No. 446, adopted Sept. 13, 2000, amended section 1 of Ord. No. 274. 
    Section 2: That an amended franchise agreement shall be executed by and between the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Florida, Comcast Cablevision of Broward, Inc., and Comcast Cable Communications, Inc. Said amended franchise agreement and the franchise granted hereunder are expressly subject to all ordinances and charter provisions of the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, including, but not limited to, Town Charter, Sections 298 through 303 of the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea Charter Sections 298 through 303 are deleted. However, they still apply and are incorporated herein by this reference. 
Editor's note- Section 3 of Ord. No. 446, adopted Sept. 13, 2000, amended section 2 of Ord. No. 274 to read as herein set out. 
    Section 3: That the facilities attendant to the construction and operation of the cable television system shall be so located or re-located and so erected as to interfere as little as possible with traffic over the streets, alleys, bridges and public places of the Town, and with reasonable egress from and ingress to abutting property. The location or re-location of all facilities shall be made under the supervision and with the approval of such representatives as the governing body of the Town may designate for the purpose, but not so unreasonably to interfere with the proper operation of such facilities and service. That when any portion of a street is excavated in the location and re-location of any of the facilities or equipment of the system, the portion of the street so excavated shall, within a reasonable time and as early as practicable after such excavation, be replaced by the franchisee at its expense and in as good condition as it was at the time of such excavation. 
    Section 4: That Comcast Cablevision of Broward, Inc., and Comcast Cable Communications, Inc., in addition to all other taxes and fees required to be paid to the Town under its code or ordinances or under state law, shall pay to the Town an amount equal to five percent of its annual gross revenues derived from its operation in the Town for each year of this amended franchise agreement. 
    "Annual gross revenues" means any revenue derived directly or indirectly by Company from the operation of its CATV system to provide cable service, within the franchise area, including revenues received by its affiliates, subsidiaries, parent, or any other person, in which company has a financial interest of five percent or more, where such revenue in the ordinary course of business should have been paid to company. By way of illustration and not limitation, this definition would include revenue derived from the sale of CATV system advertising time by an affiliate of Company. Annual gross revenues shall include, but are not limited to, pay cable fees, installation and re-connection fees, franchise fees collected from subscribers, leased channel access fees, converter rentals, fees for cable internet service (unless in accordance with applicable law such service is not a cable service), home shopping revenues, all cable service lease payments from the CATV system, payments for security alarm services, and advertising revenues. The term does not include taxes on services furnished by company and impose directly upon any subscriber or user by federal, state, or local law and collected by company on behalf of such governmental unit, or amounts collected from subscribers for public, educational, and government access. Nor does the term include any revenues earned by the company through the provision of telecommunications services as defined under the Telecommunications Act of 1996. Annual gross revenues shall not include charges for service calls, disconnects, deposits, or other similar one-time charges other than set forth above. 
Editor's note- Section 4 of Ord. No. 446, adopted Sept. 13, 2000, amended section 4 of Ord. No. 274 to read as herein set out. 
    Section 5: The annual gross subscriber revenue fees required to be paid by the franchisee to the Town under the terms of this amended franchise agreement shall be due and payable on a quarterly basis within 60 days following the third, sixth, ninth and twelfth calendar months of each year of the term of this amended franchise agreement. At the end of each year of the term of this amended franchise agreement, and following the preparation of a financial report required by said amended franchise agreement, franchisee shall remit any additional sums due as a result of such report. A late charge of $5,000.00 or 1% of gross subscriber revenues received by the franchisee, during the preceding 12-month period, whichever is greater, shall be paid for each period that such additional payment is late. Should the franchisee be delinquent in any of its payment obligations under this amended franchise agreement for a period of 120 days, the franchisee shall be considered in default and this amended franchise agreement shall be terminated in accordance with the procedures set forth elsewhere therein, unless an extension should be granted by the Town Commission. Any such extension shall be limited to a period of 90 days and late charges will not be waived. 
    Section 6: That, except where preempted by federal law, all rates for services charged by the franchisee to the public shall at all times be reasonable and be subject to the supervision, direction and control of the Town Commission, provided the rate allowed shall be sufficient to insure a reasonable return on the investment made by the franchisee. 
    Section 7: [Repealed.] 
Editor's note- Section 5 of Ord. No. 446, adopted Sept. 13, 2000, repealed former section 7 of Ord. No. 274 in its entirety. Former section 7 was previously amended by Ord. No. 313,  1, adopted April 11, 1989. 
    Section 8: That where the amended franchise agreement between the Town and Comcast Cablevision of Broward County, Inc., is more restrictive than any ordinances or charter provisions of the Town, said amended franchise agreement shall govern; where said agreement is less restrictive than said charter provisions or ordinances, then said ordinances or charter provisions, as the case may be, shall govern. 
Editor's note- Section 6 of Ord. No. 446, adopted Sept. 13, 2000, amended section 8 of Ord. No. 274 to read as herein set out. 
    Section 9: That by exercising the privilege herein granted to construct and operate the cable television system aforementioned, Comcast Cablevision of Broward County, Inc., and Comcast Cable Communications, Inc., shall be deemed to have consented to the terms and conditions hereof. 
Editor's note- Section 7 of Ord. No. 446, adopted Sept. 13, 2000, amended section 9 of Ord. No. 274 to read as herein set out. Section 9 of Ord. No. 274 was previously amended by Ord. No. 313,  2, adopted April 11, 1989. 
    Section 10: That said amended franchise agreement shall comply and be subject to provisions and conditions pursuant to the Charter of the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea and shall comply with Federal Communications Commission Regulations pertaining to cable television franchises and the Cable Communications Policy Act of 1984. 
Editor's note- Section 8 of Ord. No. 446, adopted Sept. 13, 2000, amended section 10 of Ord. No. 274 to read as herein set out. 
    Section 11: That Comcast Cablevision of Broward County, Inc., shall exercise none of the rights granted to it pursuant to this ordinance and the amended franchise agreement aforementioned until it has complied with the insurance requirements set forth in said amended franchise agreement. 
Editor's note- Section 9 of Ord. No. 446, adopted Sept. 13, 2000, amended section 11 of Ord. No. 274 to read as herein set out. 
    Section 12: Comcast Cablevision of Broward County, Inc., may be required to implement "open access" to its cable system to non-affiliated internet access providers if legally permissible. 
Editor's note- Sections 10 and 11 of Ord. No. 446, adopted Sept. 13, 2000, added new sections 12 and 13 to Ord. No. 274. Section 12 of Ord. No. 446 renenbered formers sections 12-15 of Ord. No. 274 as section 14-17. 
    Section 13: Should it be determined or ruled by the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) or any other legislative body or court having jurisdiction that any costs to company may not be passed-through to the subscriber, company shall immediately cease the practice of passing-through such costs to subscribers, yet still be required to pay such costs in the same manner as prior to the legislation, rule, or court ruling. 
Note- See editor's note to section 12 of this division. 
    Section 14: That if any clause, section or other part of this ordinance shall be held invalid or unconstitutional by any court of competent jurisdiction, the remainder of this ordinance shall not be affected thereby, but shall remain in full force and effect. 
Note- See editor's note to section 12 of this division. 
    Section 15: That all ordinances or parts of ordinances in conflict herewith, be and the same are hereby repealed. 
Note- See editor's note to section 12 of this division. 
    Section 16: That this ordinance shall be in full force and effect immediately upon the date of its final passage. 
Note- See editor's note to section 12 of this division. 
    Section 17: Selkirk Communications Limited is hereby released from all of its responsibilities and obligations under the Amendment to Franchise Agreement dated October 8, 1985 and the Unconditional and Continuing Guarantee executed by Selkirk Communications Limited in 1985 issued to the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea. (Ord. No. 313,  3, 4-11-89) 
Note- See editor's note to section 12 of this division.

DIVISION 2. - COMCAST MH HOLDINGS, INC.[6] 
ORDINANCE NO. 351 
AN ORDINANCE OF THE TOWN OF LAUDERDALE-BY-THE-SEA, FLORIDA APPROVING CHANGES OF CONTROL FROM MACLEAN HUNTER LIMITED TO COMCAST MH HOLDINGS, INC.; APPROVING AN AMENDMENT TO THE FRANCHISE AGREEMENT SUBSTITUTING COMCAST AS PARENT GUARANTOR AND AUTHORIZING THE PROPER TOWN OFFICIALS TO EXECUTE AN ACCEPTANCE RELATING TO THE FRANCHISE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE TOWN OF LAUDERDALE-BY-THE-SEA, FLORIDA, AND SELKIRK COMMUNICATIONS, INC. DATED OCTOBER 17, 1985; AND PROVIDING FOR AN EFFECTIVE DATE. 
    WHEREAS, pursuant to Ordinance 256 adopted November 28, 1978, and amended by Ordinance 274 adopted September 24, 1985 ("Amendment to Franchise Agreement"), the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea ("Town") granted a franchise to SELKIRK COMMUNICATIONS, INC., (the "Franchisee"), which is an indirect wholly-owned subsidiary of Maclean Hunter Limited ("MHL"), to construct, operate and maintain a cable television system over and beneath the public streets and other public properties of the Town; and 
    WHEREAS, the Town and Selkirk entered into the Franchise Agreement on December 8, 1978, as amended, and the Amendment to the Franchise Agreement on October 8, 1985 (collectively the "Franchise Agreement"); and 
    WHEREAS, Comcast MH Holdings, Inc. ("Comcast") desires to purchase from Rogers Communications, Inc. ("Rogers") the shares of the ultimate holding company related to the Franchisee, Maclean Hunter, Inc. ("MH-U.S.") through a transaction (the "Transaction") more fully described in Exhibit 1 to this Ordinance; and 
[ Note- Exhibit 1 referenced above is not set out herein.] 
    WHEREAS, Rogers will briefly exercise control over MH-U.S. and thereafter seeks to relinquish its rights and obligations under the Franchise to Comcast at such time as all steps contemplated by the Transaction are completed; and 
    WHEREAS, MHL, Rogers, and Comcast petitioned the Town of June 29, 1994, seeking the Town's approval to changes of control related to the Franchisee as set forth in the Transaction to the extent such approval may be required under terms of the Town's Franchise; and 
    WHEREAS, the Franchise granted by Ordinance No. 256, as amended, will continue to be held by the Franchisee; and 
    WHEREAS, Comcast guarantees that the Franchisee will continue to operate the cable system the Town, so as to comply with all lawful terms of the Franchise; and 
    WHEREAS, after duly reviewing the legal, technical, character, and financial qualifications of Comcast, the Town Commission of the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea hereby finds, determines and declares the changes of control related to Franchise are not adverse to the public interest. 
    NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED BY THE TOWN COMMISSION OF THE TOWN OF LAUDERDALE-BY-THE-SEA, FLORIDA: 
    Section 1. The Town Commission of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea hereby consents to, ratifies, and approves the changes of control as set forth in the Transaction related to Selkirk Communications, Inc., subject to the execution and delivery of an Acceptance Agreement by Comcast MH Holdings, Inc. in a form substantially the same as Exhibit 2 hereto. 
    Section 2. This Ordinance constitutes all actions and approvals of the Town necessary to consent to, approve and ratify the changes of control set forth in the Transaction and including pledging of the Franchise or its assets. 
    Section 3. Pursuant to this Ordinance, the Town Commission hereby authorizes the proper Town Officials to execute the Acceptance Agreement. 
    Section 4. This Ordinance shall become effective upon its passage and upon the execution and delivery of the Acceptance Agreement by Comcast and shall continue and remain in effect thereafter. 
PASSED and ADOPTED on first reading this 23rd day of August, 1994. 
PASSED and ADOPTED on second reading this 14th day of September, 1994. 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 14, 1994.

EXHIBIT 2. ACCEPTANCE AGREEMENT 
    THIS AGREEMENT is entered into between the Comcast MH Holdings, Inc. ("Comcast") and the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Florida (the "Town") pursuant to Ordinance No. 351; Ordinance Approving the Changes of Control of the Franchise, a copy of which is attached hereto as Attachment A. 
    Section 1. Comcast agrees that upon taking control of the indirect parent company of Selkirk Communications, Inc. ("Selkirk") (which holds a cable television franchise for the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea), Comcast shall take all necessary actions to cause Selkirk to operate its cable television system in accordance with all lawful franchise requirements and applicable federal, state and local laws then in effect. 
    Section 2. The Town warrants that the franchise is in full force and effect and that, to the best of the Town's knowledge, the cable television system is in compliance with all material terms of its franchise and all other applicable federal, state and local laws, and that there are no pending amendments to the franchise or pending or threatened proceedings involving franchise non-compliance. 
    Section 3. The Town agrees that, as of the delivery of the Acceptance Agreement by Comcast and the filing of a notification by Rogers Communications, Inc. ("Rogers") (in a form substantially the same as Attachment B hereto), that the sale of the shares of Maclean Hunter, Inc. to Comcast has been completed, Rogers and its subsidiaries and its predecessors in interest shall be released from any and all claims by the Town arising under the franchise or by any third parties asserting rights derived under the franchise. 
[ Note- Attachment B is not set out herein.] 
    The foregoing was agreed to and entered into between the Town and Comcast on the 14th day of September, 1994.

AN ORDINANCE OF THE TOWN COMMISSION OF THE TOWN OF LAUDERDALE-BY-THE-SEA, FLORIDA; APPROVING THE FRANCHISE AGREEMENT WITH COMCAST TO UTILIZE THE TOWN'S PUBLIC WAYS TO PROVIDE CABLE SERVICE OVER THE CABLE SYSTEM; PROVIDING FOR CONFLICTS; PROVIDING FOR SEVERABILITY; PROVIDING FOR INCLUSION IN THE CODE; AND PROVIDING AN EFFECTIVE DATE.

ARTICLE IV. - SOUTHERN BELL TELEPHONE AND TELEGRAPH COMPANY 
ORDINANCE NO. 258 
AUTHORIZING THE SOUTHERN BELL TELEPHONE AND TELEGRAPH COMPANY TO USE THE PUBLIC STREETS OF THE TOWN OF LAUDERDALE-BY-THE-SEA, FLORIDA, FOR THE PURPOSE OF ERECTING, CONSTRUCTING, MAINTAINING AND OPERATING LINES OF TELEPHONE AND TELEGRAPH THEREON AND THEREUNDER. 
    Section 1. Be it ordained by the Town Commission of the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Florida (herein called the "Grantor"), that permission be and the same is hereby granted to the Southern Bell Telephone and Telegraph Company, (herein called the "Grantee"), its successors and assigns, to construct, maintain and operate lines of telephone and telegraph, including the necessary poles, conduits, cables, fixtures and electrical conductors upon, along, under and over the public roads, streets and highways of the Grantor, as its business may from time to time require, provided that all poles shall be neat and symmetrical. 
    Section 2. The work of erecting poles and constructing underground conduits under this ordinance shall be done subject to the supervision of the Grantor, and the Grantee shall replace or properly repave and repair any sidewalk or street that may be displaced by reason of such work, and upon failure of the Grantee so to do, after 20 days' notice in writing shall have been given by the Mayor of the Grantor to the Grantee, the Grantor may repair such portion of the sidewalk or street that may have been disturbed by the Grantee, and collect the cost so incurred from the Grantee. 
    Section 3. In consideration of the rights and privileges herein granted, the Grantee shall pay to the Grantor annually a sum equal to one percent of the gross receipts of the Grantee from rentals* derived from telephones in use within the corporate limits of the Grantor, provided that there shall be credited against such sum the amount of all taxes, licenses, fees and other impositions (except ad valorem taxes and amounts for assessments for special benefits, such as sidewalks, street pavings and similar improvements) levied or imposed by the Grantor upon the Grantee's property, business or operations and paid during the preceding fiscal year as defined herein. Payment shall be made to the Grantor for each of the years that this ordinance is in effect and shall be based on the receipts of the Grantee for the preceding fiscal year. For the purposes of this payment, such fiscal year shall end on the last day of the month in which the ordinance becomes effective. Payment shall be made within six months of the end of such fiscal year. 
* ..."as defined in that certain letter dated February 19, 1979 and attached hereto, and such other local service recurring charges as may be made by Grantee during the term of this Franchise".... 
    Section 4. The Grantor shall in no way be liable or responsible for any accident or damage that may occur in the construction, operation or maintenance by Grantee of its facilities hereunder, and the acceptance of this ordinance shall be deemed an agreement on the part of the Grantee to indemnify Grantor and hold it harmless against any and all liability, loss, cost, damage or expense, which may accrue to Grantor by reason of the neglect, default, or misconduct of grantee in the construction, operation, or maintenance of its facilities hereunder. 
    Section 5. All rates and rules and regulations established by Grantee from time to time shall at all times be reasonable and Grantee's rates shall at all times be subject to such regulation as may be provided by law. 
    Section 6. The Grantee shall file with the Town Clerk of the Grantor its acceptance of this ordinance on or before April 5, 1979. 
    Section 7. Nothing in this ordinance shall be construed as a surrender by the Grantor of its right or power to pass ordinances regulating the use of its streets. 
    Section 8. This ordinance shall be in force and effect for a term of 30 years from and after its passage. ;b11; Approved:

      John R. Forrest, Mayor       I, Juanita Pendlebury, Town Clerk, hereby certify that the above is a true and correct copy of an ordinance which had its first reading on the 13 day of Feb., 1979, and which had its second reading on the 27 day of Feb., 1979, and which was adopted by the Town Commission of the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Florida, at a meeting held on the 27 day of Feb., 1979.

ARTICLE V. - WASTE PRO USA, INC.[7] 
ORDINANCE No. 2017-06 
AN ORDINANCE OF THE TOWN COMMISSION OF THE TOWN OF LAUDERDALE-BY-THE-SEA, FLORIDA, APPROVING THE 2017 RESTATED SOLID WASTE AND RECYCLABLE COLLECTION FRANCHISE AGREEMENT WITH WASTE PRO USA, INC.; AUTHORIZING THE SECOND RENEWAL TERM FOR A PERIOD FROM MAY 18, 2017 TO NOVEMBER 30, 2021; AUTHORIZING EXECUTION OF THE 2017 AMENDED AND RESTATED FRANCHISE AGREEMENT; PROVIDING FOR CONFLICTS, SEVERABILITY, AND FOR AN EFFECTIVE DATE. 
    WHEREAS, in 2009, the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea issued a Request for Proposals for solid waste and recycling services for the residences and businesses within the corporate limits of the Town; and 
    WHEREAS, five (5) companies responded to said Request for Proposals 09-02-01, and the submittals were reviewed by the Town staff, as well as the Town Commission, who provided an independent evaluation; and 
    WHEREAS, on May 12, 2009 the Town adopted Ordinance 2009-13 and entered into a Solid Waste, Bulk Waste and Recycling Collection Services Agreement, (the "Franchise Agreement") with the top ranked firm, Choice Environmental Services Of Broward, Inc. ("Choice") for an initial three year term, with three (3) optional renewal periods of three to five years each; and 
    WHEREAS, on March 27, 2012, the Town Commission adopted Ordinance 2012-03, exercised the first renewal and adopted a restated Franchise Agreement (the "2012 Restated Franchise Agreement") for the first renewal period of June 21, 2012 to June 30, 2015 (the "First Renewal Term"); and 
    WHEREAS, in 2014, Progressive Waste Services, Inc, a successor in interest to Choice, ("Progressive") advised the Town that it entered into an agreement with Waste Pro USA, Inc. ("Waste Pro") providing for Waste Pro's purchase of certain assets of Progressive, and Progressive requested the Town's approval of the transfer of the Restated Franchise Agreement to Waste Pro; and 
    WHEREAS, on August 19, 2014, the Town approved the transfer of the Restated Franchise Agreement to Waste Pro and Waste Pro has been providing collection services for the Town since that time; and 
    WHEREAS, on January 13, 2015, the Town Commission approved Ordinance 2014-20, the First Amendment to the 2012 Restated Collection Franchise Agreement, which extended the first renewal term for a six-month period to November 30, 2015, and deleted certain provisions related to the expiration of the Town's Solid Waste Disposal Interlocal Agreement with Broward County on July 2, 2013; and 
    WHEREAS, on November 24, 2015, the Town Commission approved Ordinance No. 2015-14, which approved the 2015 Restated Franchise Agreement providing for a one year extension of the First Renewal Term through November 30, 2016, and amendments to improve the operations of the solid waste and recyclable collection system; and 
    WHEREAS, on November 15, 2016, the Town Commission approved a 90-day extension to the First Renewal Term through February 16, 2016, and on February 14, 2017, the Town Commission approved another 90-day extension of the First Renewal Term through May 17, 2017, to provide time for the parties to negotiate the terms of the Second Renewal Term of the Agreement; and 
    WHEREAS, the 2017 Restated Franchise Agreement, attached as Exhibit "A", (the "2017 Restated Franchise Agreement") exercises the Second Renewal Term for a period commencing on May 18, 2017 and continuing to November 30, 2021, and provides amendments for clarification of terms and adjustments of rates, and is found to be in the best interests of the Town. 
Note- Exhibit "A" is not set out herein. 
    NOW THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE TOWN COMMISSION OF THE TOWN OF LAUDERDALE-BY-THE-SEA, FLORIDA, AS FOLLOWS: 
    SECTION 1. Recitals. The foregoing "Whereas" clauses are ratified and confirmed as being true, correct and reflective of the legislative intent underlying this Ordinance and are hereby made a specific part of this Ordinance. 
    SECTION 2. Adoption of Agreement. The 2017 Restated Franchise Agreement between the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea and Waste Pro USA, Inc., attached as Exhibit "A" and made a part hereof by this reference, which provides for the renewal of the Franchise Agreement for the Second Renewal Term, is hereby approved and adopted. 
    SECTION 3. Execution of Agreement. The appropriate Town officials and staff are authorized to execute the 2017 Restated Franchise Agreement, attached as Exhibit "A", together with such non-material changes as are acceptable to the Town Manager and approved as to form and legal sufficiency by the Town Attorney. 
    SECTION 4. Conflicts. All sections or parts of sections of the Code of Ordinances, all ordinances or parts of ordinances and all resolutions or parts of resolutions in conflict herewith, be and the same, are hereby repealed to the extent of such conflict. 
    SECTION 5. Severability. Should any section or provision of this Ordinance, or any paragraph, sentence or word, be declared by a Court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, such decision shall not affect the validity of the remainder hereof, as a whole or a part hereof, other than the part declared to be invalid. 
    SECTION 6. Effective Date. This Ordinance shall become effective upon adoption on second reading. 
    Passed on the first reading, this 25th day of April, 2017. 
    Passed and adopted on the second reading, this 9th day of May, 2017.

ARTICLE VI. - 2019 RESTATED SOLID WASTE, BULK WASTE, AND RECYCLING COLLECTION SERVICES AGREEMENT WITH WASTE PRO USA, INC.[8] 
ORDINANCE No. 2019-01 
AN ORDINANCE OF THE TOWN COMMISSION OF THE TOWN OF LAUDERDALE-BY-THE-SEA, FLORIDA, APPROVING THE 2019 RESTATED SOLID WASTE, BULK WASTE, AND RECYCLING COLLECTION SERVICES AGREEMENT WITH WASTE PRO USA, INC. ("2019 RESTATED COLLECTION AGREEMENT"); AUTHORIZING AMENDMENTS INCLUDING COMMINGLED WASTE, NUMBER OF CARTS IN DUPLEXES, PENALTIES; AUTHORIZING EXECUTION OF THE AGREEMENT; PROVIDING FOR CONFLICTS, SEVERABILITY, AND FOR AN EFFECTIVE DATE. 
    WHEREAS, in 2009, the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea issued a Request for Proposals No. 09-02-01 for solid waste and recycling services for the residences and businesses within the corporate limits of the Town on May 12, 2009 the Town adopted Ordinance 2009-13 and entered into a Solid Waste, Bulk Waste and Recycling Collection Services Agreement, (the "Collection Agreement") with the top ranked firm, Choice Environmental Services Of Broward, Inc. ("Choice") for an initial three year term, with three (3) optional renewal periods of three to five years each; and 
    WHEREAS, on March 27, 2012 the Town Commission adopted Ordinance 2012-03, exercised the first renewal and approved the 2012 Restated Collection Agreement for the first renewal period of June 21, 2012 to June 30, 2015 (the "First Renewal Term"); and 
    WHEREAS, in 2014, Progressive Waste Services, Inc, ("Progressive") a successor in interest to Choice, advised the Town that it entered into an agreement with Waste Pro USA, Inc. ("Waste Pro") providing for Waste Pro's purchase of certain assets of Progressive, and Progressive requested the Town's approval of the transfer of the 2012 Restated Collection Agreement to Waste Pro; and 
    WHEREAS, on August 19, 2014, the Town approved the transfer of the 2012 Restated Collection Agreement to Waste Pro and Waste Pro has been providing collection services for the Town since that time; and 
    WHEREAS, on January 13, 2015, the Town Commission adopted Ordinance 2014-20, the First Amendment to the 2012 Restated Collection Agreement, which extended the first renewal term for a six-month period to November 30, 2015, and deleted certain provisions related to the expiration of the Town's Solid Waste Disposal Interlocal Agreement with Broward County on July 2, 2013; and 
    WHEREAS, on November 24, 2015, the Town Commission adopted Ordinance No. 2015-14, which approved the 2015 Restated Collection Agreement providing for a one-year extension of the First Renewal Term through November 30, 2016, and amendments to improve the operations of the solid waste and recyclable collection system; and 
    WHEREAS, on November 15, 2016, the Town Commission approved a 90-day extension to the First Renewal Term through February 16, 2016, and on February 14, 2017, the Town Commission approved another 90-day extension of the First Renewal Term through May 17, 2017, to provide time for the parties to negotiate the terms of the Second Renewal Term of the 2015 Restated Collection Agreement; and 
    WHEREAS, the May 9, 2017, the Town Commission adopted Ordinance 2017-06, which approved the 2017 Restated Collection Agreement; and 
    WHEREAS, the 2019 Restated Collection Agreement, attached as Exhibit "A", (the "2019 Restated Collection Agreement") amends the 2017 Restated Collection Agreement to 
    WHEREAS, on August 19, 2014, the Town approved the transfer of the 2012 Restated Collection Agreement to Waste Pro and Waste Pro has been providing collection services for the Town since that time; and 
    WHEREAS, on January 13, 2015, the Town Commission adopted Ordinance 2014-20, the First Amendment to the 2012 Restated Collection Agreement, which extended the first renewal term for a six-month period to November 30, 2015, and deleted certain provisions related to the expiration of the Town's Solid Waste Disposal Interlocal Agreement with Broward County on July 2, 2013; and 
    WHEREAS, on November 24, 2015, the Town Commission adopted Ordinance No. 2015-14, which approved the 2015 Restated Collection Agreement providing for a one-year extension of the First Renewal Term through November 30, 2016, and amendments to improve the operations of the solid waste and recyclable collection system; and 
    WHEREAS, on November 15, 2016, the Town Commission approved a 90-day extension to the First Renewal Term through February 16, 2016, and on February 14, 2017, the Town Commission approved another 90-day extension of the First Renewal Term through May 17, 2017, to provide time for the parties to negotiate the terms of the Second Renewal Term of the 2015 Restated Collection Agreement; and 
    WHEREAS, the May 9, 2017, the Town Commission adopted Ordinance 2017-06, which approved the 2017 Restated Collection Agreement; and 
    WHEREAS, the 2019 Restated Collection Agreement, attached as Exhibit "A", (the "2019 Restated Collection Agreement") amends the 2017 Restated Collection Agreement to improve communication regarding commingled waste, and modify provisions including, but not limited to, missed collections, required number of carts in a duplex, and penalties; and 
    WHEREAS, the 2019 Restated Collection Agreement is found to be in the best interests of the Town. 
    NOW THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE TOWN COMMISSION OF THE TOWN OF LAUDERDALE-BY-THE-SEA, FLORIDA, AS FOLLOWS: 
    SECTION 1. Recitals. The foregoing "Whereas" clauses are ratified and confirmed as being true, correct and reflective of the legislative intent underlying this Ordinance and are hereby made a specific part of this Ordinance. 
    SECTION 2. Adoption of Agreement. The 2019 Restated Collection Agreement between the Town of Lauderdale-By-The-Sea and Waste Pro USA, Inc., attached as Exhibit "A" and made a part hereof by this reference, is hereby approved and adopted. 
    SECTION 3. Execution of Agreement. The appropriate Town officials and staff are authorized to execute the 2019 Restated Collection Agreement, attached as Exhibit "A", together with such non-material changes as are acceptable to the Town Manager and approved as to form and legal sufficiency by the Town Attorney. 
    SECTION 4. Conflicts. All sections or parts of sections of the Code of Ordinances, all ordinances or parts of ordinances and all resolutions or parts of resolutions in conflict herewith, be and the same, are hereby repealed to the extent of such conflict. 
    SECTION 5. Severability. Should any section or provision of this Ordinance, or any paragraph, sentence or word, be declared by a Court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, such decision shall not affect the validity of the remainder hereof, as a whole or a part hereof, other than the part declared to be invalid. 
    SECTION 6. Effective Date. This Ordinance shall become effective upon adoption on second reading. 
Passed on the first reading, this 9 th day of April, 2019. 
Passed and adopted on the second reading, this 14 th day of May, 2019.
